properties.Project_Description: A volunteer-driven water quality monitoring program that equips coastal communities with real-time pollution data to guide advocacy and resilience.
properties.Location: Rockaway Beach, New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: A network of community-led resilience hubs that combine infrastructure, technology, and local capacity to strengthen frontline neighborhoods against extreme weather.
properties.Location: South Bronx, New York City, NY

properties.Project_Name: CHEF Community Climate and Health Ambassador (CCHA) Youth Internship Program
properties.Project_Description: A youth “train-the-trainer” program that builds climate and health literacy among underserved communities to address heat and flooding risks.
properties.Location: Bedford Stuyvesant, New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: A modular, low-energy outdoor cooling installation using mist, shade, and native plantings to provide relief and spur permanent cooling solutions.
properties.Location: Various Locations New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: A data-driven initiative offering detailed flood risk insight, mitigation support, and swift recovery assistance to vulnerable households.
properties.Organization: Center for New York City Neighborhoods

properties.Project_Name: The National Wildlife Federation Resilient Schools & Communities Program Annual Beach Grass Plantings for Dune Restoration in Coney Island Creek Park
properties.Project_Description: A student-led coastal restoration effort planting beach grasses to enhance dune resilience and engage youth in climate adaptation.
properties.Location: Coney Island New York City, NY
properties.Organization: The National Wildlife Federation (NWF) Resilient Schools & Communities Program (RISC)

properties.Project_Description: A community-centric resilience planning initiative that embeds local voices early in infrastructure prioritization across New York neighborhoods.

properties.Project_Name: Village of Sleepy Hollow Climate Action Plan
properties.Project_Description: A municipally tailored, community-informed roadmap addressing sea-level rise, flooding, and heat with both mitigation and adaptation strategies.

properties.Project_Name: Hunters Point North: Vision Plan for Resiliency
properties.Project_Description: A locally grounded master plan integrating living shorelines, elevated infrastructure, and equitable development to shield waterfront communities from climate impacts.
properties.Location: Long Island City New York City, NY
properties.Organization: Long Island Community Coalition/Hunters Point Community Coalition

properties.Project_Name: Rockland Planning & Land Use with Students
properties.Project_Description: A long-running educational design program that empowers students to apply climate resilience and sustainable planning principles to local redevelopment.
properties.Organization: Rockland County Task Force on Water Resources Management

properties.Project_Name: Interim Flood Protection Measures (IFPM) Program - (5 boroughs)
properties.Project_Description: A citywide deployable system of pre-installed and just-in-time measures providing temporary coastal flood protection to vulnerable infrastructure.

properties.Project_Name: NYCHA South Jamaica Houses Cloudburst Project
properties.Project_Description: A first-of-its-kind urban stormwater system in NYCHA housing combining green and gray infrastructure to capture and store heavy rainfall.
properties.Location: South Jamaica New York City, NY
properties.Organization: New York City Housing Authority and New York City Department of Environmental Protection

properties.Project_Description: A waterfront marsh restoration led by students and local stakeholders to both protect shoreline resilience and enrich habitat.

properties.Project_Name: Restoration of our Hudson River Saltwater Marsh
properties.Project_Description: A district-scale flood defense system combining fixed barriers and deployables to safeguard tens of thousands of residents, jobs, and properties.

properties.Project_Name: South Battery Park City Resiliency Project
properties.Project_Description: A resilient shoreline park transforming a former industrial site into Manhattan’s first public beach with marsh and recreational access.
properties.Location: Battery Park New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: A proactive, citywide effort to plant trees strategically in heat-vulnerable neighborhoods to enhance cooling, air quality, and stormwater benefits.
properties.Organization: Field Operations, ECOncrete, Hudson River Park Trust

properties.Project_Description: A dynamic nature-based shoreline with adaptive management, local workforce stewardship, and habitat restoration to buffer coastal hazards.
properties.Organization: NYC Department of Parks and Recreation

properties.Project_Description: A climate-adaptive, LEED-Gold library doubling as a community hub and storm-resilient anchor for disaster recovery.
properties.Location: Jamaica Bay, New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: A layered coastal resilience system combining ecologically-enhanced breakwaters, oyster restoration, and education to protect shoreline communities.
properties.Location: Far Rockaway New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: An elevated waterfront park that integrates flood risk mitigation into accessible ecological and recreational open space along Newtown Creek.
properties.Location: Staten Island New York City, NY

properties.Project_Description: A master plan transforming a polluted, flood-prone waterfront into a multi-benefit green infrastructure network to manage water and enhance public access.
A project that rerouted creek flow into its historic floodplain to reduce flooding while restoring habitat and connectivity.
A fully nature-based coastal resilience project replacing failing bulkheads with salt marsh and rock sill habitat that supports biodiversity and recreation.

properties.Project_Name: Shorefront Park Living Shoreline and Little Creek Stream Restoration
properties.Project_Description: A groundbreaking, 1,300-foot living shoreline project that replaced a failing bulkhead with nature-based infrastructure, enhancing flood resilience, biodiversity, and community access while setting a precedent for sustainable coastal engineering in New York.
properties.Organization: VHB Engineering, Surveying, Landscape Architecture and Geology, PC

properties.Project_Name: Plant Pelham Native: Community Roadside Wildlife Habitat Restoration
properties.Project_Description: This initiative replaced traditional turf with native plantings to boost ecological function, reduce stormwater runoff and pollution, and engage the community in hands-on environmental stewardship.
properties.Organization: The Environmental Coalition of the Pelhams

properties.Project_Description: A stream restoration project removing a dam and installing climate-ready culverts to improve flood resilience and restore the natural function of the East Branch of the Ausable River.
Focused on upgrading culverts and removing streamflow barriers, this program restores aquatic connectivity and flood resilience while supporting local biodiversity and infrastructure protection.
properties.Organization: Adirondack Research Consortium, Adirondack Climate Outreach and Resilience Network (ACORN)

properties.Project_Description: Replaced over 500 feet of hardened shoreline with native vegetation and soil-filled log cribs to prevent erosion, restore habitat, and provide long-term ecological and aesthetic benefits.
properties.Organization: Office of Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation

properties.Project_Name: Wellesley Island Wildlife Crossing and Road Realignment
properties.Project_Description: Realigned and reconstructed a key access road with a large culvert and wildlife crossing to improve safety, connectivity, and ecological function between wetlands and the St. Lawrence River.
